DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Perpendicular Axis To Longest Diameter Disease Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The longest diameter value in centimeters for a primary tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Perpendicular Axis To Longest Diameter Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The size of a tumor._A straight line through a body or figure that is at a right angle to a given line or plane._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several._Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference._Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An abnormal tissue growth resulted from uncontrolled cell proliferation.  Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant ones exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredName: Perpendicular Axis To Longest Diameter Measurement
Property.preferredDefinition: A straight line through a body or figure that is at a right angle to a given line or plane.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.:Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

Concepts.definition: A straight line through a body or figure that is at a right angle to a given line or plane.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.
Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The measurement of a tumor's diameter.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
